verse_content.Sanskrit:
यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता ।
योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः ॥ १९ ॥
verse_content.Transliteration:
yathā dīpo nivāta-stho
neṅgate sopamā smṛtā
yogino yata-cittasya
yuñjato yogam ātmanaḥ
verse_content.Word_by_word: yathā—as; dīpah—a lamp; nivātasthah—in a place without wind; na—does not; iṅgate—waver; sā upamā—compared to that; smṛtā—likened; yoginah—of the yogi; yata-cittasya—whose mind is controlled; yuñjatah—constantly engaged in; yogam—meditation; ātmanaḥ—on Transcendence.
verse_content.Translation: As a lamp in a windless place does not waver, so the transcendentalist, whose mind is controlled, remains always steady in his meditation on the transcendent Self.
verse_content.Purport: A truly Kṛṣṇa conscious person, always absorbed in Transcendence, in constant undisturbed meditation on his worshipable Lord, is as steady as a lamp in a windless place.
